dynamic_line: <greet>  My man told me about you.  You want to become one of us?

responses.text: I just wanted to get as close to you as possible to kill you all by looking you in the eyes.

dynamic_line: Then why do you wasting my time, <name_b>?

responses.text: I'm sorry, I couldn't get him back alive…
I would like to ask you about something…
I've been in Refugee Center recently…
Look, maybe you let him go?
Let me get him out of here and finish him off in the forest.  I don't want to get anything dirty here.

dynamic_line: What a joker.  Do what you was told to do or get the hell out.
Okay, just be fast.  Be careful not to attract the <zombies>.
What do you want to know?
I don't quite trust you yet, <name_g>.  Show yourself better, then we'll talk.

We are freedom fighters.  We are the Quebec Liberation Army and we believe that Quebec should be free and independent!  Although, why are all these slogans now… now only a shadow of our former greatness remains now.  After <the_cataclysm>, we lost all sense of continuing our movement.  Quebec gained independence, but at what cost?  At the cost of the death of all usurpers, but also of all people?  And almost nothing was left from the region… everything that did not burn, was bombed, and now there are only ruins.  Ruins full of <zombies>.  Now we are an ordinary gang of thugs who simply had nowhere else to go.  We are called Forest Snakes.  A fitting name for a bunch of daredevils who haven't left the woods for years.

responses.text: Wait a minute, I heard you were called Hell's Raiders.

and: This is not true, but at the same time it is true.  And vice versa.  We are part of a larger organization, but at the same time, we are on our own.  I would describe it as a flimsy alliance of different gangs, which sometimes feel comfortable under one common flag.  Although often we just fight each other for influence and territory.  But what influence is there, influence on what?  A pile of rubbish and rot?  I don't understand this, honestly, <name_g>.  Sometimes it seems to me that all this is an illusion, and in fact, everything is arranged much more complicated.

and.yes: I think that during the shod everything will become clear…

responses.text: What can you tell about other bands?

dynamic_line: A major redistribution is coming.  All the gang leaders recently received a strange message asking them to come to one place, with the coordinates of this place, the date and a strange code.  Messages were brought by couriers, and what is most interesting is the couriers themselves: they were some green gorillas, two and a half meters tall, swollen muscles, brick faces, in huge armor, armed with something incomprehensible, and looked more like stupid robots than people.  I exchanged opinions with the guys and with other leaders and we decided that it was still worth going.

and: Of the biggest gangs, I only know the Red Suns and Sunset Bikers.  The Red Suns are mainly sane guys, various smugglers, black market dealers and other members of the trading underground.  But their new leader is rot and carrion, which still needs to be looked for.  Rumor has it that he was a guinea pig for some army experiments in a secret laboratory in this state.  And when <the_cataclysm> began, he managed to escape, killed the old leader, and now took over the leadership himself.

and.yes: I hope that this <name_b> did not poison the earth with its rotten body, but burned to ashes somewhere in the wasteland.

and: They often carry various rarities, from simple goods to experimental weapons.  I can't imagine where they get them.  The Sunset Bikers are just like any biker gang before <the_cataclysm>.  Junkies, drug addicts, lovers of steel horses and homemade flails from a chain and a piece of concrete.  You get the picture.  Sane guys, sometimes violent.  Their leader is a nice fella, we pass a few bears with him on Fridays.

and.yes: Sorry for him, of course.  He was a nice fella.

responses.text: But how did you, so different, come together and become under a common, albeit formal, flag?

dynamic_line: Hmm… you asked me a question to which I have no answer.  Now I myself am interested.  I'll think about it.

This is our little fort, he-he.  We have been sitting in these forests for many years, and as you can see, we managed to settle down here a little.  A bit cramped, but enough for us.  We was lucky the local authorities were greedy enough for money to forget about our presence for a while.  After <the_cataclysm>, purely decorative structures suddenly became quite a decent defense against hordes of <zombies> and other <monster>.
Who I was before, I think you can guess for yourself.  I don’t want to talk about the rest.
I'm kinda busy right now.  Come back in a few days.

no.yes: I', still thinking, <name_g>.  Give me some time.

responses.text: I just talked to the guys from the Red Suns.  They don't really like their leader.  Any thoughts on this?
There are a lot of guys of some 'Red Suns' gang or something.

dynamic_line: There's WHO?!  Is this <swear> <name_b> got ahead of me and took it before my guys?  <swear> <name_b>, <ill_kill_you>!  Why <swear> <swear!> did my guys not report this to me?  Okay, thanks for the warning, <name_g>.  I'll think about what can be done.

responses.text: Maybe I can help you somehow?

dynamic_line: Hmm, I don't even know how you can help me.  But if you can find a way to solve this problem, I would be grateful.
Hmm, that's how it is.  I think I have an idea.  Now I need to contact Mister T to see what we can agree on.  When you have time, talk to him about it, say that I sent you.  Now go.

dynamic_line.yes: Dead, and the hell with him.  Thanks for dealing with him.  Go get your reward from our recruiter.
dynamic_line.no: Dead, and the hell with him.

dialogue.offer: Good.  Prove it.  We captured urban rat of so called 'Free merchants' that tried to took what is OURS.  In OUR territory!  Kill him, then we can talk about you.
dialogue.accepted: Make it fast, I don't have all day to wait for you.
dialogue.advice: Do it, or get the hell out.  Consider this as advice.
dialogue.success: Ha!  I like your style.  A little sloppy, but it works.  Consider yourself a friend of the snakes.

description: Bring back Forrest Snakes informant from Refugee Center.

dialogue.offer: I need you to return to that refugee center and bring back my <name_g>.
dialogue.accepted: Don't lose my men or you'll be sorry.
dialogue.advice: Do it, or get the hell out.  Consider this as advice.
dialogue.success: Well done.  I appreciate what you did.  Consider that you earned my personal trust.  I told my guys that you can be trusted.  Maybe they have some work for you too.

description: Raid Refugee Center and kill Merchant, Broker, Doctor and OG Rep.

dialogue.offer: It's time to act.  We have been looking closely at this center for quite some time.  It is quite spacious, there are many different supplies, and most importantly, it is full of helpless survivors.  In short, we need to capture this center.  Are you in business?
dialogue.accepted: Raid Refugee Center and kill everyone inside.  If you need help, take my men with you, they can help you.  You're free to go.
dialogue.advice: Remember to do some scouting before you start.  If you can, from the inside.  Find out the route of their patrols, the sentry posts, all that.
dialogue.success: Well done, <name_g>.  We will immediately begin preparations for the move.  Go get your reward from our recruiter.

description: This person is alive and well.  If this mission fails, it means that this person is dead.
